text: Experience vacation living every day in this stunning, fully-renovated 2-bedroom / 2.5-bathroom waterfront condo on City Island, just 30 mins from Manhattan. The extra-large chef's kitchen is equipped with beautiful quartz countertops, Italian farmhouse sink, abundant storage including pantry, and stainless-steel appliances. text: Nestled at the end of a cul-de-sac in the private community of Fieldston, this remarkable home stands out for its quality, character, and privacy. On almost half an acre of land with no neighbors on either side, it's a light flooded gem. The home has been lovingly and meticulously renovated, including the expansive windowed kitchen (which offers double sinks, double dishwashers and even two ovensone gas and one electric) and its five and half bathrooms. The renovations are not just for appearance; plumbing, electrical and HVAC have all been substantially upgraded. Entering through the gracious foyer, you are immediately drawn to the light streaming in through the expansive east facing windows and glass doors. On your right is a fabulous living room with a wood-burning fireplace and French doors out to the bluestone patio. To your left is a wonderful, paneled library with built-in bookshelves and a second fireplace. Also on the first floor is a powder room and the magnificent kitchen/great room, which encompasses the spacious dining room with its inviting window bench. The second floor offers a large primary suite with working fireplace, an office area and lovely bath, and Juliet balcony. On this level there are three additional roomy bedrooms, two more baths and abundant closet space. The full third floor serves as a recreational space with a den for television viewing, a wet bar, ping pong and more--most especially a glorious terrace overlooking Van Cortlandt Park. This level also offers an additional two full baths, and even more spacious storage. Outside, there are plenty of spaces to relax or entertain. The large back bluestone patio and a smaller bluestone terrace next to the kitchen are both perfect for entertaining and barbecuing. A walkway leads to the lower property with a seating area, and, of course, there is the sun-drenched third-floor terrace. On the lower level, there's a wine cellar and copious storage, plus an attached spacious garage. Few homes in the city offer this rare combination of space and privacy as well as easy access to the subway, Metro North, express busses, and local transportation, as well as shopping, Van Cortlandt Park horse riding stables & golf course, and great local restaurants. text:
Don't miss this rare opportunity to live in one of the most sought-after prewar co-operatives in the Grand Concourse Historic District! This perfect one-bedroom apartment has everything you could want: a beautiful view of the Concourse and the Andrew Freedman Home, endless sunlight from the West, and your own in-unit washer/dryer.
Step into the expansive entry foyer, which features a spacious coat closet, and you'll know this is your home.. On your left is the enormous windowed eat-in kitchen with stainless-steel appliances, an abundance of cabinet space, and a wraparound countertop. Enjoy the gas range, dishwasher, built-in microwave and spacious refrigerator. And don't worry, there's room for a real dining table.
Straight ahead are the king-sized bedroom and your truly glorious living room, each with two large, historic windows framing the beautiful Grand Concourse view. 1100 Grand Concourse is the only co-op in the landmark district to have recently replaced their windows with accurate reproductions that are energy efficient, impervious to noise, and incredibly beautiful. Enjoy the most unbelievable skies and sunsets over massive trees. Serenity is yours.
Nearly 100 years old, the original wood floors have been restored to their glory, as has the intricate brick exterior of the building. A renovated bathroom and plenty of additional closet space complete the picture.
1100 Grand Concourse is a well-maintained co-op offering a live-in super, live-in porter, two elevators, a common laundry room and a grand lobby filled with light. 10% down payment permitted and subletting is permitted after two years of residency with board approval. Pets are welcome on a case by case basis with some breed and weight restrictions on dogs.
Ideally located on the corner of East 166th Street and Grand Concourse, public transportation options cannot be beat, and the neighborhood offers plentiful dining, park and retail options. The B/D train and multiple bus lines are on the very same block, with the Express 4 train just a few blocks away. The Bronx Museum, The Andrew Freeman Home, Yankee Stadium, Blink Fitness, Planet Fitness, The Bronx Terminal Market, Mullaly Park, and Joyce Kilmer Park are all nearby. Additional monthly capital assessment of $209.97.

text: Showings by Appointment Only - Welcome to 4515 Douglas Avenue, an exquisitely private and serene home, offered for the first time in generations. Situated on one of the largest lots in Riverdale and nestled at the end of a cul-de-sac, this secluded home is surrounded by mature plantings and flowering bushes that frame the surrounding lawn and hardscaped bluestone patios. Ample land extending all the way to Palisade Avenue, leaves endless possibilities for expansion and more. This unique property offers a rare opportunity for comfortable, peaceful, and gracious living. The interior of this home is beautifully designed, with original millwork, casement windows, and hardwood floors throughout. The sprawling first floor features a well-balanced mix of formal and casual spaces, ideal for indoor-outdoor entertaining. The first floor is anchored by artfully hand-carved front and rear wood doors, leading to a grand living room with a wood-burning fireplace and adjoining sunroom. The fully enclosed sunroom is heated, bathed in natural light, and works perfectly as a playroom or media room. A cozy den/library with custom pocket doors and a gas fireplace is also attached to the living room. The large, eat-in kitchen is adjacent to the formal dining room, which has French doors leading to an outside patio. There is also a first-floor powder room and laundry for added convenience.Upstairs, the primary suite boasts an en-suite bath, gas fireplace, and dual walk-in closets. There are three other comfortable bedrooms and two more full baths, one with a claw foot soaking tub and stand-alone glass shower. A large balcony off the bathroom acts like an outdoor living room and is the perfect place to enjoy the sun. The third floor features two additional bedrooms and another large well proportioned full bath. The large, unfinished basement and attics leave many possibilities for additional living space and storage. This home is loaded with historical charm, yet there are still many modern conveniences and features to make day-to-day life a breeze. Some special features of this home include a flat front entrance, a two-car garage, and an oversized driveway with room for guests. The large eat-in kitchen has a separate entrance to the outside as well as easy access to the basement. There is gas heat throughout the home. Upgrades abound, including a stunning architecturally designed first-floor extension that currently serves as a home office and gym. It features a separate entrance through a wall of glass doors that can fully open to the outside. This is the way to work from home in style! This beautiful home is located in the coveted Estate area, just south of Hudson Hill and adjacent to the Delafield Estates. It is one short block from the canopied passage of Palisade Avenue, which is one of the oldest and most peaceful area in Riverdale. The residential architecture in this neighborhood integrates beautifully into the natural landscape, and sets it apart from the urban grid layout found nearby in Manhattan. Houses of worship, public and private schools, restaurants, and shopping are all close at hand. Drive to Lincoln Center in 15 minutes or zip down to Grand Central on Metro North in 25. This is truly the best of both worlds.home is closer than you think!

text:
Yes, finally, there IS a renovated prewar, art deco, two-bedroom, two-bathroom home in a landmarked doorman building on the famed Grand Concourse. Rarely available and highly-coveted, this perfectly-laid out apartment is in mint condition and ready for you to move right in. Throughout you'll find skim-coated walls, refinished original oak floors with walnut borders, original moldings and built-ins, all updated with every contemporary convenience.

Travel back in time to 1941 as you enter 6F and find yourself passing the enormous, renovated, windowed chef's delight of an eat-in-kitchen on your right and three spacious closets to your left. Move on to the gracious dining foyer, which is big enough for dinner parties and includes an original built-in bookcase. Directly ahead through a beautiful archway and down two steps is the oversized dropped south-facing living room with large windows and incredible light. Living and entertaining here is a joy!Off the foyer head down the hall and you'll find yourself passing the king-sized second bedroom, another large closet, and the renovated, windowed main bathroom featuring an oversized period bathtub and pedestal sink. Next, enter the beautiful primary suite that features two closets, a renovated, windowed en-suite bath with stall shower, and signature corner windows that are an incredible four feet wide, plus an additional window letting in amazing light all day. This bedroom easily accommodates a king-sized bed, nightstands, dresser, and home office area.

All this in a true art-deco building constructed in 1941 and located directly across from the impressive Bronx Supreme Courthouse. Part-time doorman. Dogs permitted (under 40 pounds). Less than 20 minutes to midtown, with easy subway access to the East and West sides of Manhattan. Minutes from Yankee Stadium, the bridge to Harlem, and the entrance to I-87. Near shopping, parking, recreational facilities and parks. Don't wait!

text: Historic Two-House Combo: Spacious 8-Bd. Victorian Landmark with Gracious Porches, Large Patio & Broad Lawns on Over Three-Quarters of an Acre THE RESIDENCE This spacious 8-bedroom, 4-bath residence consists of two houses connected by a family room with a wood-burning fireplace. The home enjoys multiple covered porches and a large, inviting patio - perfect for al fresco dining and entertaining. There are broad, level lawns to the front, back and side. Features include: an entry hall; living room with French doors out to a columned porch; formal dining room; 2 kitchens; family room with a vaulted skylight ceiling; large den; master bedroom suite; finished attic bedroom; unfinished basements. There is a long, private driveway (280 ft.) leading to a detached 2-car garage. There is a also a large storage shed. The property spans approximately 0.82 acres. THE HISTORY & ARCHITECTURE The main wing (known as the H.F. Spaulding Estate Coachman's House) was built around 1880 and designed by the architect Charles W. Clinton in the picturesque Victorian Stick style. The smaller wing was built around 1860. Both buildings were relocated to their current site from the Wave Hill estate across the street in 1909, and they were linked by a one-story addition in 1968. Historically and architecturally significant, the residence was designated a city landmark in 1981 and was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1982. According to the Guide to New York City Landmarks, "Lively and varied textures are created by board-and-batten siding on the first floor, crossed sticks above, dormer windows with jigsaw ornament, and a slate roof with overhanging eaves." The authoritative AIA Guide to New York City (3rd Edition) uses one word to describe the Coachman's House: "Glorious." THE SETTING Situated on one of Riverdale's most bucolic avenues, and directly across from the exquisite greenery of Wave Hill public gardens and culture center, the home is close to well-known private schools (Horace Mann, Fieldston, Riverdale Country School and SAR Academy), the Riverdale Yacht Club and the Metro-North trains and express buses to Manhattan.

This lovely apartment is located in a prewar building designed by the architect, Horace Ginsbern that designed the first Art Deco building in the Bronx. The building is setback with a entry pathway that leads to the building. The apartment has been renovated, while maintaining the original prewar details such as: entry foyer, high ceilings, arches, setback shelf, floor to ceiling closets throughout, basket weave wood floors and windows in each room.The large windowed eat-in-kitchen has been renovated. It has ample cabinet, counter and storage. The highlight of this apartment is that the full washer/dryer has been grandfathered in. The dining area is adjacent to the kitchen. There is a Grand arch that you pass through to enter the quite spacious living room. It is sunny with south east exposure and open city views. It has a split-bedroom design, as the primary bedroom is on the other side of the apartment. This apartment is oversized with bathroom ensuite, double floor to ceiling closets and double windows. The 2nd bedroom is sunny and it too as open views. There is a windowed elegant black and white bathroom in the hallway.The architects of this period were famous for their setback terraces. Seasonal Rose trellis's adorn the front of the building. The entry path has Italian hand laid bricks with a center garden with seasonal flora, plants and trees. At the end of the walkway is a Zen fountain on a hill with flora. The entrance to the building was renovated a few years ago and it has an intercom. The original windowed stone Art Deco lobby has stone floors and a staircase that ascends to the top floor with the original wooden handrail. The mail room has new mailboxes. The building has a wonderful live-in-super and a live-in assistant, individual storage (outside vendor) and a service entrance. Heat and hot water is included in the maintenance, which is one of lowest maintenances in the Riverdale area. Sorry DOGS are no longer allowed. CATS are welcome.The bus stops for the Jitney to the Metro North, MTA local and express buses are across the street.The #1 subway is three blocks east of the avenue. Ewen Park (adjacent to bldg) best known for sledding when it snows. You are a short distance to the Riverdale, Johnson and Broadway shopping, trendy, ethnic, fast food restaurants, Starbucks, gyms, Riverdale Spa and Tennis. There is out door garage parking across the street and indoor around the corner on 231st, Manhattan College, Riverdale Country, Ethical Culture, Horace Mann, Fieldston are within a five minute drive by car or bus. JFK H.S. and the International H.S. Charter School are within a two block radius.

text: DEVELOPMENT & RENOVATION OPPORTUNITY: The Old Hadley Farm House - 5-Bd. Landmark with Sunroom, 2-Car Garage & Yard on a Third of an Acre, Zoned R4 In need of renovation, the old Hadley farm house is a 5-bedroom, 2.5-bath, stone and wood-frame structure that may be the oldest home in the Bronx. According to some historians, the main portion of the 18th century dwelling could have been built as early as 1747 (which would make it one year older than the nearby Van Cortlandt Mansion). The Hadley House was designated as a New York City landmark in 2000. The central portion of the house has stone walls nearly two feet thick. The supporting beams in the basement are tree trunks, slit in half, with the bark left on the round side. The house still has its original stone fireplace. In the late 19th century, a north wing was added, and in 1915-16, a south wing was added in an expansion and remodeling by the noted architect Dwight James Baum. Features include: an entry foyer; living room; formal dining room with wood-burning fireplace; eat-in kitchen; sunroom; mudroom; laundry room; detached 2-car garage. The 0.35-acre property measures 50 by 102.75 ft. (15, 413 sq. ft.) and is zoned R4. So bring your architect and your vision if you want to renovate or expand the house or develop the property further. Great access for transportation (buses and No. 1 subway train), Van Cortlandt Park and Horace Mann School.

Known for its suburban feel and beautiful homes, Riverdale is a primarily residential area with tree-lined streets and a variety of housing options ranging from single-family homes to high-rise apartment buildings. The neighborhood is situated along the Hudson River, offering scenic views and access to green spaces such as Van Cortlandt Park and Wave Hill, a public garden and cultural center. Riverdale is known for its relatively affluent population and prestigious schools, including the private Horace Mann School, Ethical Culture Fieldston School, P.S. 81 and Riverdale Country School. The area is also home to a number of cultural institutions, such as the Riverdale Yacht Club and the Riverdale Art Center. Overall, Riverdale is a peaceful and picturesque neighborhood that offers a suburban escape from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan while still being conveniently located within the city. Cleanest and best maintained building in Riverdale, don't take my word for it, come and see for yourself, financially sound, one of the best stats among many co-ops.

text:
Bank Neary Real Estate is proud to offer for sale this sophisticated and modern luxury apartment so masterfully designed and crafted that it is simply one of a kind. This is a chic downtown apartment perched high over the Grand Concourse Historic District. You'll have unmatched sweeping views from the Palisades, George Washington Bridge, the Art Deco splendor of the Grand Concourse neighborhood, down to the midtown Manhattan skyline. And watch and listen to crowds roar at Yankee Stadium. This is uptown living at its most compelling.
The apartment was created as his own home by a well-known NYC architect and president of AIANY, who has received multiple AIA and Interior Design awards, and is a recipient of the National AIA Young Architects Award. This property gives the buyer the unmatched opportunity to experience a designer's complete vision, and live in a bespoke home with all the luxury bells and whistles. Available completely or partially furnished, this turn-key residence must be seen by any design enthusiast.
Situated on the 23rd floor of the famed 24-story Executive Towers, the crown jewel of the Grand Concourse Historic District, apartment 23P is 1, 000 square feet of complete bliss and ultimate luxury. The architect radically reimagined what life could be like, taking the circa-1963 Junior-4 layout and bringing it into the 21st-century, adding a powder room and a built-in guest bed in a lofty, open floor plan. Imagine your best life. Imagine life at 1020 Grand Concourse in apartment 23P!
Enter the sleek, capacious living/dining room and you immediately know that you are home. A custom seating area, home office nook, dining room with picture window and terrace door, and hidden murphy bed allow this bright, airy space to be the center of your new life. Opposite the dining room is the large custom open kitchen, powder room, and then the corner den (convertible to bedroom) complete with a built-in bar. Outside, enjoy the amazing views and light from your beautiful balcony, which has recently received brand-new railings. Perfect for large-scale entertaining, this amazing open plan is also great for relaxing, for working at home, and for intimate dinners!
Past the luxurious custom primary bath is the quiet refuge of the bedroom, with a custom-designed floating king bed to maximize space and frame cinematic GWB views from bed at night. A 25' long wall of custom-fitted closets, all with motion-sensor lighting and 3-way mirrors provide ample storage for any fashionista.
No expense was spared in this meticulous renovation. Ask for a complete list of the incredible fixtures and finishes!
Designed by the master architect Philip Birnbaum and completed in 1963, 1020 Grand Concourse occupies the prominent corner of 165th Street directly across from the Bronx Museum of Art and conveniently located near the B, D and 4 trains, multiple bus lines, and convenient shopping and services. Four parks nearby offer amazing recreational opportunities and the feeling of living in a meticulously planned neighborhood that brings you the best of the city and the outdoors-and yet is only 20 minutes from Midtown Manhattan.
Enjoy full-service living with nothing overlooked. From the integrated central air conditioning and heating system to the 24-hour building staff, you'll be taken care of impeccably! Plus the low, low maintenance includes gas and electricity.
Building Features:
24-hour doorman and security
On-site attached garage with available assigned spaces for residents (at additional cost)
24-hour laundry rooms
Live-in super
On-site management office
BuildingLink system for communication and delivery notifications
Bicycle storage room
Recently-completed exterior restoration project
Restored historic tile entrance canopy
New automatic entry doors and lighting
And planned upgrades include lobby restoration, a fitness center, and a common garden.
All photos are REAL.

text: This open, spacious and sunny one bedroom is in a setback prewar building designed by the renown architect, Horace Ginsbern. Mr Ginsbern is credited for the first Art Deco building in the Bronx, as well as, terraced setback buildings. This apartment gives you privacy and it has western exposure, which gets brilliant afternoon sun. It has original prewar details such as the traditional curved wrought iron railing, three curved arches, high ceilings, entry foyer, set back shelf, wood floors throughout and large and deep closets that are from floor to ceiling. There are windows in each room. The Grand archway leads into the living room.The apartment has been refreshed The windowed kitchen has new stainless steel appliances, wooden cabinets and ample counter space and storage. The gracious dining area is adjacent to the kitchen. One of the arches leads to the hallway that separates the common area. The windowed bathroom has the original period tiles and prewar details. The oversized bedroom ha three (3) windows, double closets and lovely greenery.Seasonal roses are on the trellis's in the front of this handsome prewar setback elevator building. The entry path has Italian hand laid bricks with a center garden with seasonal flora, plants and trees. At the end of the pathway is a Zen fountain sitting on a hill surrounded by plantings and the Riverdale stones. The building entrance has an intercom. The Art Deco lobby has stone floors from the era, fireplace and a wooden stair ailing that ascends to the top floor. There is storage in the building (outside vendor), laundry and a service entrance.Heat and hot water are included in the maintenance. This buildings maintenance is one of the lowest in the Riverdale area and 90% financing is allowed. SORRY NO DOGS! Cats are welcome.Bus stops for the Jitney to the Metro North, MTA local and Express buses are across the street. The #1 subway is three blocks east of the avenue. Ewen Park is adjacent to the building, known for snow sledding. You are a short distance from Riverdale, Johnson Avene and Broadway shopping, trendy fast food restaurants, Starbucks, gyms, Riverdale Spa and Tennis. There is street parking and indoor and outdoor parking across the street on West 231st street, Manhattan College, Horace Mann, Fieldston, Riverdale Country and Ethical Culture are within five minutes by car or bus. International Culture H.S. and JFK H.S. are within a two block radius.
